name: src/Client.js
Client
description:
The Client class is used to connect to the server and retrieve information
 about available services and jobs.
examples:
// Obtain Client object from GSF.
const Client = GSF.client({address:'MyServer',port:9191});

name: JobCompleted
description: Emitted when a job completes.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

properties.name: success
properties.description:
A boolean set to true if the job succeeds,
 false if it fails.

name: JobSucceeded
description: Emitted when a job succeeds.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

name: JobFailed
description: Emitted when a job fails.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

name: JobProgress
description: Emitted when job progress is updated.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

properties.name: progress
properties.description: The job progress percent.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The job progress message, if any.

name: JobStarted
description: Emitted when a job starts.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

name: JobAccepted
description: Emitted when a job is accepted.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

name: ClientOptions
description: The ClientOptions object contains information about the server.

properties.name: ClientOptions.address
properties.description: The server address/name.

properties.name: ClientOptions.port
properties.description: The server port.

properties.name: ClientOptions.headers
properties.description: The headers to be used in requests.

properties.name: ClientOptions.APIRoot
properties.description: The API root endpoint.

properties.name: ClientOptions.protocol
properties.description: The protocol to use.

params.name: clientOptions
params.description: The object containing server information.

name: address
description: The server address/name.

name: port
description: The server port.

name: headers
description: The headers to use in requests

name: APIRoot
description: The API root endpoint.  If none, set to empty string.

name: protocol
description: The protocol to use.

name: URL
description: The server url.

name: rootURL
description: The API root url.

name: services
description: Retrieves an array of available services from the server.

return.description: Returns a Promise to an array of available Service objects.

name: JobListOptions
description: Filtering options for listing jobs.

properties.name: query
properties.description:
Filter jobs by specifying one or more comparison operators per property.
  Comparison operators must be prefixed with '$' and only the following are supported: $eq, $ne,
 $gt, $gte, $lt, $lte.  Queries may contain multiple properties and each property may
 contain multiple comparison operators.

properties.name: sort
properties.description:
The sort array.  This array contains an array for each sort which
 consists of the property to sort by and the direction. To sort in ascending order use 1 and
 to sort in descending order use -1.  For example, to sort by jobSubmitted date in ascending
 order: [ [ 'jobSubmitted', 1 ] ]

properties.name: offset
properties.description: The number of jobs to skip; useful for pagination.

properties.name: limit
properties.description:
Limit the number of jobs returned. Set to -1 to
 return all jobs. Note: -1 is not recommended, as it may take a long time
 to retrieve all jobs.

properties.name: totals
properties.description:
Types of total job counts to include in the response.
 Must be one of: 'all', 'none', or 'default'.  The default is 'default'.
  Set to 'none' to exclude totals.  Set to 'default' to include total count of all filtered jobs.
  Set to 'all' to include total count of all filtered jobs and the total counts of filtered jobs
 in each job status.  Totals will only be visible when used with the jobInfoList() function.

name: jobs
description: Retrieves an array of jobs on the server.

params.name: jobListOptions
params.description:
Object containing options for
 filtering job list.

return.description:
Returns a Promise to an array of
 jobs that exist on the server.

name: JobInfoList
description: A list of JobInfo objects with count and total information.

properties.name: jobs
properties.description: An array of JobInfo objects that match the search criteria.

properties.name: count
properties.description: The number of filtered jobs in the jobs array.

properties.name: total
properties.description:
The total number of jobs.  Enabled by default.
  To disable, set 'totals' to 'none' in the JobListOptions.

properties.name: accepted
properties.description:
The total number of accepted jobs.
  This can be enabled by setting 'totals' to 'all' in the JobListOptions.

properties.name: started
properties.description:
The total number of started jobs.
  This can be enabled by setting 'totals' to 'all' in the JobListOptions.

properties.name: succeeded
properties.description:
The total number of succeeded jobs.
  This can be enabled by setting 'totals' to 'all' in the JobListOptions.

properties.name: failed
properties.description:
The total number of failed jobs.
  This can be enabled by setting 'totals' to 'all' in the JobListOptions.

name: jobInfoList
description: Retrieves an array of job info objects.

params.name: jobListOptions
params.description:
Object containing options for
 filtering job list.

return.description: Returns a Promise to a JobInfoList object.

name: service
description: Returns the Service object based on service name.

params.name: serviceName
params.description: The name of the service.

name: job
description: Retrieves job object based on the job ID.

params.name: jobId
params.description: The id of the job from which to retrieve the job object.

params.name: progressCallback
params.description: The callback to handle job progress.

params.name: startedCallback
params.description:
The callback that is called when the job starts.
 For more reliable job started information, listen to the GSF JobStarted
 events as this callback may not always get called.  In some cases the job
 can start before the callback is registered.

name: src/GSF.js
GSF
description: The GSF object provides an entry point to the SDK.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The function for creating a new Client object.

name: src/Job.js
Job
description: The Job class is used for job operations.

params.name: client
params.description: The GSF Client object.

params.name: jobId
params.description: The jobId.

params.name: progressCallback
params.description: The callback to handle job progress.

params.name: startedCallback
params.description:
The callback that is called when the job starts.
 For more reliable job started information, listen to the GSF JobStarted
 events as this callback may not always get called.  In some cases the job
 can start before the callback is registered.

name: jobId
description: The job Id.

name: wait
description: Waits for the job to complete.

return.description:
Returns a promise that is resolved when a job is
 successful, returning the job results object.
 If a job fails, the promise is rejected with an error message.

name: JobInfo
description: The JobInfo object contains information about a job.

properties.name: serviceName
properties.description: The name of the service.

properties.name: taskName
properties.description: The name of the task.

properties.name: jobOptions
properties.description: Processing directives to submit along with the job.

properties.name: inputParameters
properties.description: The input parameters.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

properties.name: jobProgress
properties.description: The percentage of job completion.

properties.name: jobMessage
properties.description: A status message that is sent with progress updates.

properties.name: jobStatus
properties.description:
The status of the job. It can be Accepted,
 Started, Succeeded, or Failed.

properties.name: jobResults
properties.description: The job output results.

properties.name: jobSubmitted
properties.description: Time the job was submitted.

properties.name: jobStart
properties.description: Time the job started processing.

properties.name: jobEnd
properties.description: Time the job finished processing.

properties.name: jobError
properties.description: An error from the job, if there was one.

properties.name: nodeInfo
properties.description: Provides information about the node on which the job ran.

name: NodeInfo
description: Provides information about the node on which the job ran.

properties.name: nodeAddress
properties.description: This is the address of the machine that ran job.

properties.name: nodePort
properties.description: The port of the server that ran the job.

properties.name: workerID
properties.description: The ID of the worker that ran the job.

name: JobResults
description: The job output results.

properties.name: <parameterName>.best
properties.description:
Result from the first parameter mapper which
was able to reverse translate the output value.

properties.name: <parameterName>.raw
properties.description: The raw output value returned by the task.

name: info
description: Retrieves the job information.

return.description: Returns a promise to a JobInfo object.

name: cancel
description: Cancels the job.

params.name: force
params.description:
If true, the job will force cancel.  Please note that
 setting force to true may be unsafe depending on the type of job
 as it may not be able to properly shut down or clean up.

return.description:
Returns a promise when cancel is submitted.  If request
 is successfully submitted, the promise will be resolved with a value of true.
 If the request fails, the promise will be resolved with an error message.
 Note that this only represents the success of the request made to the server,
 not the cancellation itself.  Use the Job.Info() function (or Job events)
 to retrieve the status of the job and to learn when it is actually cancelled.

name: delete
description: Deletes the job.

return.description:
Returns a promise when delete is submitted.  If request
 is successfully submitted, the promise will be resolved with a value of true.
 If the request fails, the promise will be resolved with an error message.
 Note that this only represents the success of the request made to the server,
 not the deletion itself.  Use the Job.Info() function (or Job events)
 to retrieve the status of the job and to learn when it is actually deleted.

name: workspace
description: Retrieves a list of the workspace files.

return.description: Returns a promise to an array of fs.stat objects.

name: file
description: Retrieves a workspace file.

return.description: Returns a promise to an ArrayBuffer of the file contents.

name: src/Service.js
Service
description: The Service class is used to inspect and create tasks for a service.

params.name: client
params.description: The GSF client object.

params.name: serviceName
params.description: The name of the service.

name: name
description: The service name.

name: ServiceInfo
description: The ServiceInfo object contains information about a service.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the service.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the service.

name: info
description: Retrieves the service information.

return.description:
Returns a Promise to the
 ServiceInfo object.

name: task
description: Returns a task object.

params.name: taskName
params.description: The name of the task.

name: taskInfoList
description: Retrieves the array of task info objects available on the service.

return.description: Returns a Promise to an array of TaskInfo objects.

name: tasks
description: Retrieves the array of task objects available on the service.

return.description: Returns a Promise to an array of Task objects.

name: src/Task.js
Task
description: The Task class is used to submit and inspect tasks.

name: SubmitOptions
description:
The Submit Options object contains the information needed to run
a job.

properties.name: inputParameters
properties.description:
The input parameters to the job.  This is
 an object where the keys represent the names of the
 input parameters and the values are the inputs to the task.

properties.name: jobOptions
properties.description: Processing options to be used when running the job.

name: JobOptions
description: The Job Options object contains processing options to be used when running the job.

properties.name: route
properties.description:
The route on which to run the job if
there is one.

name: TaskInfo
description: The TaskInfo object contains information about a task.

properties.name: taskName
properties.description: The name of the task.

properties.name: serviceName
properties.description: The name of the service.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description:
A readable name for the task. This is only used for display
  purposes.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the task.

properties.name: inputParameters
properties.description: An array containing the input parameter definitions.

properties.name: outputParameters
properties.description: An array containing the output parameter definitions.

name: InputParameter
description: The InputParameter object contains information about an input parameter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the parameter.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type for the parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: A boolean representing whether or not the parameter is required.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: A display name for the parameter.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the parameter.

properties.name: default
properties.description: A default value for the parameter.

properties.name: choiceList
properties.description: A list of values that will be accepted as input for the parameter.

name: OutputParameter
description: The OutputParameter object contains information about an output parameter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the parameter.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type for the parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: A boolean representing whether or not the parameter is required.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: A display name for the parameter.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A description of the parameter.

name: JobResults
description: The JobResults object contains the job results.

name: JobProgressInfo
description: Information about job progress.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

properties.name: progress
properties.description: The job progress percent.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The job progress message, if any.

name: JobStartedInfo
description:
Called when a job starts processing.
 For more reliable job started information, listen to the GSF JobStarted
events as this callback may not always get called.
In some cases the job can start before the callback is registered.

properties.name: jobId
properties.description: The job id.

params.name: service
params.description: The service object.

params.name: taskName
params.description: The name of the task.

name: name
description: The task name.

name: service
description: The parent service.

name: info
description: Retrieves the task information.

return.description: Returns a promise to the TaskInfo object.

name: submit
description: Submits the job.

params.name: submitOptions
params.description: The job submit options.

params.name: progressCallback
params.description: The callback to handle job progress.

params.name: startedCallback
params.description:
The callback that is called when the job starts.
 For more reliable job started information, listen to the GSF JobStarted
 events as this callback may not always get called.  In some cases the job
 can start before the callback is registered.

return.description: Returns a promise to a Job object.

name: submitAndWait
description:
Submits the job and waits for results.  Resolves the promise if the job
 succeeds and rejects the promise if the job fails.

params.name: submitOptions
params.description: The job submit options.

params.name: progressCallback
params.description: The callback to handle job progress.

params.name: startedCallback
params.description:
The callback that is called when the job starts.
   For more reliable job started information, listen to the GSF JobStarted
  events as this callback may not always get called.  In some cases the job
  can start before the callback is registered.

return.description: Returns a promise to a Job object.

name: src/utils/EVENTS.js
src/utils/GSF_API.js
src/utils/utils.js

content:
GSF JavaScript Client SDK

The GSF JavaScript Client SDK provides a client-side JavaScript library for interacting with GSF. ### [ Migration Guide: v3 to v4](./manual/migration-guide-v4.html) *Update to v3 of the SDK.* ### [ Migration Guide: v2 to v3](./manual/migration-guide-v3.html) *Update to v3 of the SDK.* ### [ Installation Guide](./manual/installation.html) *Install the SDK.* ### [ Getting Started](./manual/getting-started.html) *Get started using the SDK.* ### [ Examples](./manual/examples.html) *Learn more using code examples.* ### [ API Reference](./identifiers.html) *Read the full developer documentation.*
name: ./doc/index.md

content:
{
  "name": "gsf-js-client-sdk",
  "version": "4.2.0",
  "description": "GSF JavaScript Client SDK",
  "author": "Harris Geospatial Solutions, Inc.",
  "license": "MIT",
  "main": "dist/GSF.min.js",
  "types": "./index.d.ts",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/geospatial-services-framework/gsf-js-client-sdk.git"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "clean": "shx rm -rf dist",
    "build-node": "webpack --config=build/webpack-node.config.js",
    "build-web": "webpack --config=build/webpack-web.config.js",
    "build": "npm run clean && npm run build-node && npm run build-web",
    "watch": "./node_modules/.bin/webpack --progress --colors --watch",
    "test": "npm run test-chrome-headless",
    "test-chrome": "concurrently --kill-others --success first \"node ./test/fake-server/server.js\" \"npm run prod-test-chrome\"",
    "test-chrome-headless": "concurrently --kill-others --success first \"node ./test/fake-server/server.js\" \"npm run prod-test-chrome-headless\"",
    "test-firefox": "concurrently --kill-others --success first \"node ./test/fake-server/server.js\" \"npm run prod-test-firefox\"",
    "test-node": "concurrently --kill-others --success first \"node ./test/fake-server/server.js\" \"npm run prod-test-node\"",
    "test-all": "concurrently --kill-others --success first \"node ./test/fake-server/server.js\" \"npm run prod-test-all\"",
    "prod-test-node": "mocha-webpack --webpack-config build/webpack-node.config.js \"test/**/*.test.js\"",
    "prod-test-chrome": "./node_modules/.bin/karma start --browsers Chrome",
    "prod-test-chrome-headless": "./node_modules/.bin/karma start --browsers ChromeHeadless",
    "prod-test-firefox": "./node_modules/.bin/karma start --browsers Firefox",
    "prod-test-all": "./node_modules/.bin/karma start --browsers ChromeHeadless,Chrome,Firefox",
    "help": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.10.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.10.0",
    "@babel/core": "^7.10.0",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-modules-commonjs": "^7.10.1",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.10.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.10.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.1.0",
    "babel-loader": "^8.1.0",
    "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^1.0.2",
    "body-parser": "^1.19.0",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "chai-as-promised": "^7.1.1",
    "chai-things": "^0.2.0",
    "component-ie": "^1.0.0",
    "concurrently": "^5.2.0",
    "cors": "^2.8.5",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^7.1.0",
    "eslint-loader": "^4.0.2",
    "eventsource": "^1.0.7",
    "express": "^4.17.1",
    "istanbul": "^0.4.5",
    "karma": "^5.0.9",
    "karma-chai": "^0.1.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^3.1.0",
    "karma-firefox-launcher": "^1.3.0",
    "karma-mocha": "^2.0.1",
    "karma-mocha-reporter": "^2.2.5",
    "karma-sourcemap-loader": "^0.3.7",
    "karma-webpack": "^4.0.2",
    "mocha": "^7.2.0",
    "mocha-webpack": "^2.0.0-beta.0",
    "shx": "^0.3.2",
    "sinon": "^9.0.2",
    "sse-channel": "^3.1.1",
    "superagent": "^5.2.2",
    "superagent-no-cache": "github:johntron/superagent-no-cache#efab70e6fa5f5702883c990b69929aaaaa3b7029",
    "terser-webpack-plugin": "^3.0.2",
    "webpack": "^4.43.0",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.11",
    "webpack-merge": "^4.2.2"
  }
}
name: package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
## Installation Guide
The SDK can be installed using [npm].

    $ npm install gsf-js-client-sdk

[npm]:http://npmjs.com

name: ./doc/manual/tutorial/migration-guide-v3.md
content:
# Migration Guide: Moving from v2 to v3
The gsf-javascript-client-sdk has undergone a number of changes for version 3.0.  This version is significant due to the adoption of a new HTTP API for GSF.  This means that if you upgrade your SDK to v3, you will also need to update your server(s) to GSF version 3.0. Ensure that the gsf-request-handler is enabled on the server before using version 3 of the SDK.  There are a number of breaking changes for the SDK user as a result of switching to the new API.

The purpose of this guide is to help you transition your application's source code from v2 to v3 of the SDK.

- Classes
    - [Server](#server-class)
    - [Service](#service-class)
    - [Task](#task-class)
    - [Job](#job-class)
- Types
    - [ServiceInfo](#serviceinfo)
    - [TaskInfo](#taskinfo)
    - [SubmitOptions](#submitoptions)
    - [JobInfo](#jobinfo)
    - [JobResults](#jobresults)

### Server Class
#### GSF.Server is now GSF.Client.
- The server class has been renamed to 'Client'.
- The 'ServerArgs' object is now referred to as 'ClientOptions'.

#### Client.APIRoot no longer defaults to 'ese'.
- The default APIRoot has been removed to align with the new HTTP API.

### Service Class
#### Service.info() no longer contains task list.
- See [ServiceInfo](#serviceinfo) below for details.

#### Service.taskInfoList() response changed.
- See [TaskInfo](#taskinfo) below for details.

### Task Class
#### Task.info() response changed.
- See [TaskInfo](#taskinfo) below for details.

#### Task.submit() and Task.submitAndWait() options changed.
- See [SubmitOptions](#submitoptions) for more details.

### Job Class
#### Job.info() response changed.
- See [JobInfo](#jobinfo) below for more details.

#### Job event names changed.  They are now the same as the Client events.
    - Renamed 'Accepted' to 'JobAccepted'.
    - Renamed 'Started' to 'JobStarted'.
    - Renamed 'Progress' to 'JobProgress'.
    - Renamed 'Completed' to 'JobCompleted'.
    - Renamed 'Succeeded' to 'JobSucceeded'.
    - Renamed 'Failed' to 'JobFailed'.

### Job.wait() response changed.
- See [JobResults](#jobresults) below for more details.

## Types

### TaskInfo
- Added 'serviceName'.
- Renamed 'name' to 'taskName'.
- Renamed '<parameter>.dataType' to '<parameter>.type'.
- Renamed '<parameter>.defaultValue' to '<parameter>.default'.
- Replaced 'parameters' with 'inputParameters' and 'outputParameters'.
- Removed '<parameter>.direction'
    - New 'inputParameters' and 'outputParameters' arrays indicate direction in their name.

##### Example of TaskInfo in v2
```json
{
    "name": "ISODATAClassification",
    "displayName": "ISODATA Classification",
    "description": "This task clusters pixels in a dataset based on statistics only, without requiring you to define training classes.",
    "parameters": {
        "INPUT_RASTER": {
            "name": "INPUT_RASTER",
            "parameterType": "required",
            "displayName": "Input Raster",
            "description": "Specify a raster on which to perform unsupervised classification.",
            "direction": "INPUT",
            "dataType:": "ENVIRASTER"
        },
        "OUTPUT_RASTER": {
            "name": "OUTPUT_RASTER",
            "parameterType": "required",
            "displayName": "Output Raster",
            "description": "This is a reference to the output classification raster of filetype ENVI.",
            "direction": "OUTPUT",
            "dataType:": "ENVIRASTER"
        }
    }
}
```

##### Example of TaskInfo in v3
```json
{
    "taskName": "ISODATAClassification",
    "serviceName": "ENVI",
    "displayName": "ISODATA Classification",
    "description": "This task clusters pixels in a dataset based on statistics only, without requiring you to define training classes.",
    "inputParameters": [
        {
            "name": "INPUT_RASTER",
            "type": "ENVIRASTER",
            "required": true,
            "displayName": "Input Raster",
            "description": "Specify a raster on which to perform unsupervised classification."
        }
    ],
    "outputParameters": [
        {
            "name": "OUTPUT_RASTER",
            "type": "ENVIRASTER",
            "displayName": "Output Raster",
            "description": "This is a reference to the output classification raster of filetype ENVI.",
            "required": true
        }
    ]
}
```
For full documention see [**TaskInfo**].


### ServiceInfo
- Removed 'tasks'.
    - Use Service.tasks() or Service.taskInfoList() to obtain task lists.

##### Example of ServiceInfo in v2
```json
{
    "name": "ENVI",
    "description": "ENVI processing routines",
    "tasks": [
        "Task1",
        "Task2",
        "Task3"
    ]
}
```

##### Example of ServiceInfo in v3
```json
{
    "name": "ENVI",
    "description": "ENVI processing routines"
}
```
For full documentation see [**ServiceInfo**].

### SubmitOptions
- Added 'jobOptions' object.
    - 'route' was moved into the 'jobOptions' object.
    - Any additional processing directives will reside in the 'jobOptions' object.
- Renamed 'parameters' to 'inputParameters'.

##### Example of SubmitOptions in v2
```javascript
const submitOptions = {
  parameters: {
    INPUT_RASTER: {
      FACTORY: 'URLRaster',
      URL: '/some/url'
    },
    INDEX: 'Normalized Difference Vegetation Index'
  },
  route: "ENVIRoute"
};
```

##### Example of SubmitOptions in v3
```javascript
const submitOptions = {
  inputParameters: {
    INPUT_RASTER: {
      FACTORY: 'URLRaster',
      URL: '/some/url'
    },
    INDEX: 'Normalized Difference Vegetation Index'
  },
  jobOptions: {
      route: "ENVIRoute"
  }
};
```
For full documentation see [**SubmitOptions**].

### JobInfo
- Added 'jobStart'.
- Added 'jobEnd'.
- Added 'jobSubmitted'.
- Added 'jobOptions'.
- Renamed 'inputs' to 'inputParameters'.
- Renamed 'jobErrorMessage' to 'jobError'.
- Renamed 'results' to 'jobResults'.
- Renamed 'jobProgressMessage' to 'jobMessage'.
- Removed 'jobRoute'.  This property is now in the 'jobOptions' object.
- Removed 'jobStatusUrl'.

##### Example of JobInfo in v2
```json
{
	"jobId": 3410,
	"jobStatus": "Succeeded",
	"jobStatusURL": "ese/jobs/3410/status",
	"jobProgress": 100,
	"jobProgressMessage": "Completed",
	"jobRoute": "default",
	"taskName": "SpectralIndex",
	"serviceName": "ENVI",
	"jobErrorMessage": "",
	"inputs": {
		"index": "Iron Oxide",
		"input_raster": {
			"url": "/some/url",
			"factory": "URLRaster"
		}
	},
	"results": {
        "OUTPUT_RASTER": {
			"url": "/some/url",
			"factory": "URLRaster",
			"auxiliary_url": [
				"/some/url"
			]
        }
	},
	"messages": [{
			"type": "esriJobMessageTypeInformative",
			"description": "Submission Time: Mon Jan 29 2018 16:07:52 GMT-0700 (Mountain Standard Time)"
		},
		{
			"type": "esriJobMessageTypeInformative",
			"description": "Start Time: Mon Jan 29 2018 16:07:52 GMT-0700 (Mountain Standard Time)"
		},
		{
			"type": "esriJobMessageTypeInformative",
			"description": "End Time: Mon Jan 29 2018 16:08:01 GMT-0700 (Mountain Standard Time) (Elapsed Time: 8.818 seconds)"
		}
	]
}
```

##### Example of JobInfo in v3
```json
{
	"jobId": 3410,
	"jobProgress": 100,
	"jobMessage": "Completed",
	"jobStatus": "Succeeded",
	"taskName": "SpectralIndex",
	"serviceName": "ENVI",
	"inputParameters": {
		"index": "Iron Oxide",
		"input_raster": {
			"url": "/some/url",
			"factory": "URLRaster"
		}
	},
	"jobResults": {
		"OUTPUT_RASTER": {
			"best": {
				"url": "/some/url",
				"factory": "URLRaster",
				"auxiliary_url": [
					"/some/url"
				]
			},
			"ese-job-parameter-mapper": {
				"url": "/some/url",
				"factory": "URLRaster",
				"auxiliary_url": [
					"/some/url"
				]
			}
		}
	},
	"jobOptions": {
		"route": "default"
	},
	"jobSubmitted": "2018-01-29T23:07:52.992Z",
	"jobStart": "2018-01-29T23:07:52.995Z",
	"jobEnd": "2018-01-29T23:08:01.813Z"
}
```
For full documentation see [**JobInfo**].

### JobResults
- Each parameter now contains all of the parameter mappings.  The highest ranked mapping is set to the 'best' key.

##### Example of JobResults in v2
```json
{
    "OUTPUT_RASTER": {
        "url": "/some/url",
        "factory": "URLRaster",
        "auxiliary_url": [
            "/some/url"
        ]
    }
}
```

##### Example of JobResults in v3
```json
{
    "OUTPUT_RASTER": {
        "best": {
            "url": "/some/url",
            "factory": "URLRaster",
            "auxiliary_url": [
                "/some/url"
            ]
        },
        "ese-job-parameter-mapper": {
            "url": "/some/url",
            "factory": "URLRaster",
            "auxiliary_url": [
                "/some/url"
            ]
        }
    }
}
```
For full documentation see [**JobResults**].


[**ServiceInfo**]:../typedef/index.html#static-typedef-ServiceInfo
[**TaskInfo**]:../typedef/index.html#static-typedef-TaskInfo
[**SubmitOptions**]:../typedef/index.html#static-typedef-SubmitOptions
[**JobInfo**]:../typedef/index.html#static-typedef-JobInfo
[**JobResults**]:../typedef/index.html#static-typedef-JobResults

name: ./doc/manual/tutorial/migration-guide-v4.md
./doc/manual/tutorial/getting-started.md
./doc/manual/tutorial/examples.md
./CHANGELOG.md
content:
# Change Log
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## 4.2.0 / 2021-10-26

### New Features
- Support for GSF 3.0:
    - Add job delete functionality, matching job deletion functionality in GSF.

## 4.0.0 / 2020-06-22

### New Features
- Support for GSF 3.0:
    - Add 'query' option to JobListOptions for more advanced querying of the job database.
    - Add 'sort' option to the JobListOptions for flexible sorting of the job list.
    - Add 'totals' option to JobListOptions for totals broken down by job status.

### Breaking Changes
- Changes related to GSF 3.0:
    - Change jobId type from number to string to support the new 'uniqueJobIds' configuration option in GSF.
    - Remove 'reverse' and 'status' options from JobListOptions in favor or more powerful 'sort' and 'query' options.
    - The JobInfoList is now an object containing the jobs array, job count, and totals.

For a detailed summary of the changes, see the V4 Migration Guide and examples in the documentation.

## 3.0.0 / 2018-03-21

### New Features
- Updated the SDK to use the new GSF HTTP API.

### Breaking Changes
- Several breaking changes were made for this release.  For a detailed summary of the changes, see the Migration Guide in the documentation.

## 2.2.0 / 2018-03-22

### New Features
- Added Server.jobInfoList() for fetching an array of the current JobInfo objects.

### Bug Fixes
- Fix #10 - Server.jobInfoList() will retrieve full JobInfo objects from the server.

## 2.1.0 / 2018-03-21

### New Features
- Added headers object to the ServerArgs object to allow custom headers to be used in requests.

## 2.0.0 / 2017-07-24

### New Features
- Added the ability to use the SDK in Node.js.  See documentation for more details.

### Breaking Changes
- Task class: Replaced 'server' and 'serviceName' constructor arguments with 'service'.  This only affects Task objects created using the Task class constructor; there is no change to Task objects created using the Service.Task() method.  See API documentation for more details.

## 1.0.0 / 2017-02-26

### New Features
- Add a change log.
